intro: Polium chamaedryoides, commonly known as the common wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and narrow, gray-green leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Polium chamaedryoides is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
